item.title: Report E-2024090335
item.description:
Report E-2024090335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1558ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal USA in Sacramento, CA. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of UN1760 SHINELINE EMULSIFIER PLUS released from (1) carton containing (4) 1-gallon jugs of product due to the box being crushed by the boxes stacked on top of it. The release impacted the trailer floor, the pallet, and a second carton. ERTS reviewed the SDS and determined that a contractor is necessary due to the corrosivity (Class 8). ERTS dispatched a contractor to perform cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to 2'x2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents and sodium bicarb solution to the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged bottle impacted cardboard and cleanup debris were containerized to 2â€“55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090315
item.description:
Report E-2024090315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0517 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UKC. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Ipex PVC Primer was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3194574. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Terminal personnel generated a 5-gallon poly drum of waste which was staged on site.

item.title: Report X-2024090481
item.description:
Report X-2024090481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/31/2024 tank car TILX 135685 was called in with an odor. During the initial assessment, the tank car was found with a manway cover gasket and a nozzle gasket. The cover gasket was deteriorated and cut causing an obstruction and a vapor release. The nozzle gasket showed no signs of issues. The cover gasket was removed as it is not needed when you have a nozzle gasket in place, and because it was damaged. GrayMar Environmental assisted with the response.

item.title: Report X-2024090480
item.description:
Report X-2024090480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: Industry
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container HGIU 506270 was releasing at the City of Industry Yard in Industry, CA. Contractor responded and found inadequate blocking and bracing causing a load shift. 12x 5-gallon pail of UN1263 released 15 gallons inside the container. United Pumping(contractor) secured the load and cleaned all impacted areas. Damaged pails were overpacked and placed back in the container.

item.title: Report X-2024090629
item.description:
Report X-2024090629

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Yard personnel reported a white liquid releasing from the HGIU 5300358. Upon inspection of the container one paint can was found damaged on the bottom of the can and empty. The paint can was on the bottom of the pallet in a cardboard box with a total of 4 cans in the box and 18 boxes on the pallet. The box and can appeared to be damaged from the weight of the boxes above it. The spilled paint was remediated, and the load was resecured.

item.title: Report X-2024090537
item.description:
Report X-2024090537

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The external overpack marked box was dented on the sides and two edges when it was discovered. The flaps on the underside of the box, were loose, as the water activated tape that was supposed to secure them shut was frayed. When the box was inspected , the granules were visible at the bottom interior of the box. The lid of the inner plastic pail had a divot gouged on the edge circumference.
